title: Chicken Piccata
description: Pan-seared chicken cutlets finished in a bright lemon, white wine and caper sauce. Lightly dredged and sautéed for a golden crust, then simmered briefly so the tangy buttery sauce coats each piece.

ingredients.display_name: skinless boneless chicken breasts, split or pounded to 1/2-inch thickness
ingredients.notes: about 3 large breasts before splitting, yields 4 cutlets
divide into 2 tbsp and 2 tbsp portions

ingredients.display_name: dry white wine (or additional chicken broth)
ingredients.notes: pinot grigio or sauvignon blanc recommended
used combined with wine for sauce

steps.text: Prepare the chicken: halve thick chicken breasts horizontally or place between plastic and pound to 1/2-inch thickness; pat dry and season both sides with salt and half the black pepper.
Set up dredging station: place seasoned flour on a plate. Dredge each cutlet in flour, shaking off excess, and set on a tray.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and add 2 tablespoons butter and 3 tablespoons olive oil. When the butter foams, add chicken in a single layer (work in batches if needed).
Sear the chicken without moving until golden brown, about 3 minutes per side, then transfer cooked cutlets to a warm plate and tent with foil.
Reduce heat to medium, add minced garlic to the pan and sauté briefly until fragrant, about 30 seconds, scraping up brown bits from the pan with a wooden spoon.
Deglaze the pan with white wine, scraping the fond; simmer until the wine is reduced by about half, approximately 2–3 minutes.
Add chicken broth, lemon juice and capers, bring to a gentle simmer and cook 2–3 minutes to meld flavors and slightly reduce the sauce.
Return chicken to the skillet and simmer in the sauce for 2 minutes to reheat and finish cooking through, spooning sauce over the cutlets.
Remove pan from heat and swirl in remaining butter to finish and slightly thicken the sauce; taste and adjust seasoning with remaining black pepper and salt if needed.
Plate the chicken, spoon sauce and capers over each piece, garnish with chopped parsley and lemon slices, and serve immediately.
